Reviews.Title: A nifty little camera
Reviews.Author: Nematoda
Reviews.Content: I'm just a point-and-shoot guy, and all I wanted was a good point-and-shoot camera with a powerful zoom lens, and good picture quality for an admittedly undiscerning eye. I got all that and more with this camera. Since there are plenty of "expert" reviews, I'm not going to say anything about the ins-and-outs of the camera. So, for what it's worth, here are my random comments.1. Besides the 30x optical zoom on the SX510, the other cool feature is the wifi capability. Setting up the wifi was not particularly intuitive, but I eventually got everything working. I read one review from a mac owner that the wifi would not transfer pictures wirelessly from the camera to the the Apple computer. That's not true. All you need to do is download some Canon software (available here: [...] Once you download and install the software, you need to connect your computer to the camera via your home wifi network. Again, this isn't very intuitive, but it's not too difficult either. After the connection is made, you'll be able to transfer photos from the camera to your Apple computer via the "Image Sync" command.2. One reason I decided to get a new camera (I upgraded from an older Canon Powershot, the S3) was because my old camera took terrible pictures indoors and in low light. I read that the SX510 did much better. To my untrained eye, this certainly seems to be the case. I took a couple of indoor pictures that turned out very poorly on my S3; using the SX510, the same shots were significantly better. On close inspection, I could see some "noise," but relatively speaking, the differences were huge.3. The SX510 is very compact and light. One big reason, of course, is that it uses a proprietary battery, rather than 4 AAs. A lot of people prefer AAs for obvious reasons, but as long as you are prepared, the proprietary battery should not be a problem. You can buy extra batteries online (on Amazon) for a very low price. Having extra batteries will help you avoid those sad situations of not having batteries when you need them.Well, that's all I can think of for now.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Les
Reviews.Content: I have the professional Canon 5D Mark 2 camera with all the lenses, flash filters and everything else, but I needed a small camera for riding my motorcycle to events. After researching I settled on the Canon PowerShot SX510 HS, which I am glad I did. The first weekend I took over 300 photographs and I am extremely happy with this camera. I was really surprised at how small it is but it does take a nice 12 meg picture. For the price, I can't imagine using anything else.

Reviews.Title: 5 Stars so far, truly impressed
Reviews.Author: LoveMyKindle! "Amy"
Reviews.Content: Wow.  This is a truly amazing little camera.  I bought this to replace my Nikon Coolpix.  I had my coolpix for just over 12 months when it broke, due to no fault of my own, and it was going to cost $150 to repair.  Rather than repair a camera that I liked but didn't love, I decided to make a new purchase.My initial intention was to purchase a Canon Rebel, I have used my mom's in the past and really love that camera.  I loved using the interchangeable lenses and the ability to manually focus.  Seeing the cost though ($500+,) plus the cost of additional lenses, it just wasn't in my price range at the moment and I needed a new camera urgently.  If you're looking for a DSLR, do not expect this to function the same.  It's a powerful little camera, but it is NOT a DSLR.  If you're an amateur photographer and have no intention of taking a class to learn how to use the functions of a DSLR, this is a perfect camera for you.So began my research.  It became a toss up between the Canon SX510 and the Nikon L820.  Reviewers were split between the two, some preferring the Nikon, some preferring the Canon.  They seemed to come out about even except in a few minor categories, and having been very pleased with the Canon Rebel, I decided to go with the Canon despite it costing about $30 more than the Nikon.Pro's-*30x Optical zoom - awesome, no more grainy pictures of kids on stage during performances*Built in wifi - go ahead and upload your pics to facebook, send them to your phone, or directly to your wireless printer.*Manual setting - can do your own iso settings, white balance, shutter speed etc.  The auto setting works fabulously in most cases, far better than any camera I've ever owned, but the option is there for those times it's just not adjusting quite how you want it.*CMOS sensor provides for a clearer image, especially on the macro setting, than my own eyes give me.*Zoom assist - for when you use your 30x zoom but lose your subject*Size - for anyone that has gone hiking with a DSLR and multiple lenses, you know what a pain that can be.  This lighter camera is perfect for running around and still has a lot of the qualities that you'd look for in a DSLR.  So unless you're out taking professional shots, this comes in really handy*Discreet mode - This is a setting on the dial, great for those events when there is no flash allowed.  In this mode, the camera doesn't make noise when turning it on, nor does the flash go off.  Even if the camera goes off and you turn it back on, because it is set on the dial, it doesn't reset itself.  I've accidentally had my flash turned back on so many times that way on previous cameras.Cons -*Very poor manual - A lot of skipping around to get one thing done.  IE Looking through the start up manual, it says "for instructions on attaching (the lens cap cord and neck strap) please see the user manual on the canon website"  Granted, it wasn't difficult to figure out, but there was no clear spot for the lens cap cord, and it is something that should have been included in a "start-up" manual.  Another example of a poor manual, referring to the downloadable pdf manual...say you want to learn how to use the miniature setting...so it says "miniature setting, pg 48"  You go to pg 48 and it says to follow steps 1 and 2 on page 46....okay back to page 46, got that down, back to page 48.  It seems to be this way when trying to learn how to access any of the features.  I can't fault the actual camera for this, but definitely Canon.  I actually made up my own cheat sheet for accessing my favorite features until I have it down.*No ability to manually focus - Being that this camera is not a DSLR, I didn't expect or really even hope for this feature.  I would have liked it, but for the $$, I definitely can't complain and will upgrade in the future.*Mirrorless - I would definitely prefer to use a viewfinder, I am used to going without though, so it's easy to work around.*No Raw Shooting - this feature doesn't apply to most people, but sometimes I prefer to use it*No Touch Screen - This is taking time for me to get used to, I find myself constantly tapping the screen.  My last 2 cameras, going back to 2010, have been touch screen, so I'm surprised to find this camera doesn't have one.Some reviewers have complained about the difficulty of accessing the wifi, this was fairly easy for me and took about 15 minutes max.  It's a little more work than it typically takes to connect a device to wifi,and you have to use the computer to do it, but it's still not overly difficult.Despite the cons, I'm still incredibly impressed with this camera and it has definitely earned 5 stars when taking into account the type of camera, the construction, and the value.  I'm very happy with this purchase despite the fact that I was hoping for my next camera to be the Rebel.  I never imagined I'd get a camera of this level of quality for under $400.  (I paid $229, could have bought a slightly cheaper one, but wanted one that was Amazon fulfilled and prime)

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: jayan
Reviews.Content: Great camera for  travellers,, fast  shooting ,, best thing i found is ,.. one can zoom while taking video.. which i have never found this feature in this  type version of cameras before

Reviews.Title: Camera stops recording HD video randomly.
Reviews.Author: Matthew H. Cole "palshark"
Reviews.Content: I wanted a camera that took awesome still shots and could shoot 1080P for my youtube projects.  I thought I had struck gold with this camera, but unfortunately I was wrong.  I tried recording videos over and over again and randomly, during the process, the camera would beep and stop recording.  Confused and irritated, I looked online, tried contacting Canon for support (that was a waste of time) and kept looking for help on forums.  Finally, I found a yahoo answers that explained what was happening.  The sensor in the camera will start to overheat, or get close to overheating and stop recording to protect itself.  Though it may be a nice feature to elongate the lifespan of your product, Canon really should have mentioned a LIMITED recording time on this product page.  It just says "Capture beautiful 1080p full HD video in stereo sound with a dedicated movie button." When it should have said, "Capture beautiful 1080p full HD video in stereo sound for a few minutes, before I get too warm and switch off."  Of course, that doesn't sound very appealing, now does it?That being said, The image quality of the photos were absolutely awesome!  So I'm very sad I'm returning this camera.Pros - Great still shot quality and great build quality.Cons - Shooting video with a sentient-like sensor that will just randomly shut off when it gets warm sucks, hardcore.

Reviews.Title: Great Quality for a Great Price
Reviews.Author: J. Cole "JCL"
Reviews.Content: I wanted a "nice" camera that was easy to use and wouldn't break the bank. This camera takes great pictures! I especially wanted a camera that works well in low light since the cheap cameras I have now are terrible with that. We were able to take nice photos in front of the Christmas tree with only the tree lights on and they turned out great!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Jeremy Crowe
Reviews.Content: My wife and I purchased this to have a good camera for taking pics of our newborn son.  We have been so pleased with it.  The zoom is absolutely incredible.  I'm sure there are many stronger and better quality cameras out there for the professionals, but for a family at home...this is awesome...especially for around $200!  Good quality video as well.  We are excited every time we upload pics to the computer to see how clear and beautiful the images of our boy are!Also, we bought extra batteries from this amazon listing:B008TX0RC6The batteries were a good price and they actually last longer than the factory canon battery.  Just a little food for thought!Also, in terms of aesthetics...the camera is very nice looking and built well.  The neck strap is nice, and the camera fits very comfortably in your hands.  Light weight!  Hope you enjoy it as much as we do!

Reviews.Title: Cannon PowerShot SX510 - A Great Camera for the Price!!
Reviews.Author: Laurence H. Wood "Onetree"
Reviews.Content: Had I not been leaving town for a trip the next day (October 18), I would have bought this through Amazon with the additional warranty, just to be safe.  The Amazon price is a great price.  This Power Shot is an upgrade from my first Cannon Powershot, the A590.  For me the selling features were, it's a Cannon and the extended telephoto 30X Optical Lens.  I've had great success with Cannon cameras, with many of the pictures I've shot with the A590 being used for magnetic photo bookmarks I sell.  The primary limitation with the A590 was the optical telephoto only being 4X with digital abilities to shoot out to 8X.  Shooting many outdoor shots, particularly of hummingbirds as an example, I could never get the quality shots I wanted.  With the SX510 I can stand off, zoom in and now have great shots.  It has all the features of the earlier A590, plus the longer telephoto, better battery life with it's Lithium Ion battery and some great new features I'm still learning.  One limitation is the lack of a viewfinder.  The digital screen is great, but a bit cumbersome to use when I zoom out to catch something in the distance.  That takes a bit to get used to and I'm still working on it.  As long as my subject doesn't move, fly off or disappear I can find it and shoot.  The other drawback is it's limited number of F stops.  I prefer the full range of F stops on my old SLR camera.  The SX510 gives you F3.4 - F8.  Although limited I have found it adequate for present.  The kit that it comes with gives you everything you need to get started.  It did take me a couple of weeks to realize that the little snap strap on the camera case is meant to snap around the camera neck harness.  That's a nice feature - I pull out the camera and don't have to fumble around trying to put the case down - I just let it hang from the neck strap and start shooting.  All in all, this is a great little camera for the price and it's a step in the right direction from earlier PowerShot cameras.  I would buy it again with no qualms.  This will do what I need, while I research Digital SLR's to replace my old film SLR.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: Sarah Inghram
Reviews.Content: I own 12 cameras.  I teach photography to middle school students and find this camera to be the easiest for my students to learn the basics and enjoy all the functions. For the price you are getting an excellent camera with an incredible zoom.

Reviews.Title: BUY THIS CAMERA!!!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Forrest Coulter "Luke coulter"
Reviews.Content: this camera is great!! the first day I got it, I found out how good it is. It has lots of zoom and when I bought a tripod for it, it worked awesomely.It is OK for beginners but it is AWSOME for people who have lots of camera experience.If you are looking for a good camera BUY THIS ONE!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for my husband for Christmas--he hunts a lot, but also loves taking pics of the wildlife. He absolutely LOVES it--the zoom feature is incredible--he took a pic of a cardinal in the woods behind our house, and it looked like it was right in our window.  Couldn't be more pleased!!

Reviews.Title: Great point and shoot, if that's what you're looking for
Reviews.Author: K. Walton
Reviews.Content: The form of this camera is small. My wife has small hands and this is perfect for her.We simply leave it on auto and it takes great photos. Just what we needed and you look cool doing it!I have no doubt this camera is capable of many things in the hands of a knowledgeable photographer. We're not that person and it still works great!

Reviews.Title: Really confusing instructions
Reviews.Author: C Murphy
Reviews.Content: This camera is perfect for us - zoom, quick shutter, wifi enabled.  HOWEVER, the instructions for getting it connected to the internet and then to your computer are a mess!  For example, the instructions tell you to enter your authentication code.  Hours of googling finally explained that the "MAC" # on the camera is the authentication code.  How was I to know that?!  Also, you need to download software from the canon site to make it connect to your computer but no where does it say where to go to download it.  And the instructions read as though they were written in some other language and then "google translated" or something.  I tried calling for help to the help line and he advised getting a USB cable to connect it to my computer.. HELLO! The wifi is this camera's big selling feature!  I finally did manage to get it working and it is wonderful, but the trek to this point was  a little arduous!  Canon - just sit down and work on your instructions!

Reviews.Title: Great with 14MP
Reviews.Author: oscar a.
Reviews.Content: This camera should be used on the 14 MP setting. I have a professional SLR Cannon and the pictures are about the same when the 510 is used in that setting. This was the clincher for me. The fact the flash has to be manually operated seem awkward at first, but is kinda ol' school and does not take anything from the camera. The video is great. Very clear and excellent quality. Overall, satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Lovely photos.
Reviews.Author: Tessa L Barranger
Reviews.Content: Only thing is no eye view finder, only the back of the camera.  It does take really crisp wonderful photos though. Great deal for the money

Reviews.Title: Defeating the panaroma shot on purpose? Wither AE lock?
Reviews.Author: Book Nut
Reviews.Content: I'm shopping for a camera in this class, and settled on either the Nikon L830, Canon 510HS, Fujifilm S8200, or Sony DSCH300. I'm a Canon-kind-of-guy, and was happy to decide to get the Canon after a comparison. The Canon has some drawbacks, but it scored enough for me to go with it—until I realized what a dumb design it truly is (fortunately I read the manual first). I.e., I probably will not spend my money on it. And I am really miffed about it, because I really wanted the Canon. So I'll share with you, FYI. There is a deal breaker with me when it comes to cameras, and it is the absence of Auto Exposure Lock (AE Lock). My itty-bitty compact 2007 Canon Digital ELPH, has it. And so do many if not most Canon cameras. It allows you to quickly get a good exposure in auto  mode, in one area of the ground/sky/wherever, and apply that exposure to the scene you want to shoot elsewhere but are struggling to get a balanced exposure on (e.g., think bright sky and dark ground in a landscape shot). I use it all the time outside, and it makes for well exposed pics really quickly without fussing. With the 510HS, for some reason, the AE Lock cancels after taking 1 pic! What?! Why would they do that? It's ridiculous. But OK, for one photo at a time I can live with it begrudgingly. But then I discovered another deal breaker I didn't realize I had in me...the camera doesn't have a panorama feature (all it's competitors do!) and it also doesn't have a Stitch-assist  function, which once again, even my low-end compact from 2007 has! It's like discovering your $100,000 car doesn't come with mirrors. So to take a panorama when you are traveling, you have to manually compose the pics without the help of an assist, and then compile it with software later. OK, once again I could deal with that very begrudgingly...except now have to keep the exposure constant somehow between all your pics! How could you do this? Well, with AE Lock. Oh. Wait. It cancels after one shot! Son of a...! Do they not want you to take panoramas?! So yes, Canon, I could work around it by fidgeting with Manual exposure for 5 minutes until I get the perfect aperture and shutter values and then take multiple images and then use software to merge the scene...but you know what, I don't have to go through that 5 minutes of hell, because I can use my 2007 compact elph to take the shot in 5 seconds, or just buy any one of your competitors' cameras with a panorama feature that'll lock the exposure. Oh well, I now realized that I secretly did want the Nikon's twice-as-fast shooting lens for safari shots anyway. Thanks for choosing the Nikon, Canon.

Reviews.Title: great camera,  was hard to figure out the wifi part of it...
Reviews.Author: Helene Miller
Reviews.Content: It's not "true" wifi.  You have to send the pictures to another device to post them on facebook....Love the camera,  but the discription is not 100% accurate

Reviews.Title: I kinda hate this camera.
Reviews.Author: KD
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera because I needed a megazoom for a specific event. First off, the camera works well and takes better pictures than it probably should. I'm a novice photographer and needed a decent point and shoot to take great pictures. It delivers and my photos are great quality, indoor and outdoor. For those who like more control, the camera also has manual controls. One tiny drawback is that the controls aren't as "intuitive" as my other digital cameras. You'll probably need the manual handy the first time you use it. No big deal. My problem is getting my fine pictures OUT of the camera. It is wireless only. Great! One less cable to keep up with. Not so fast. The setup for wireless is a colossal pain in the neck. You have to register on the Canon image gallery website. Then register the camera. Then set up the access point. Then register the computer, smartphone, tablet, etc you'd like to to send the pictures to. Fine, that is expected. After all of that, you upload the pictures and realize you can't even crop a photo on the CIG website/app, much less do any real editing. You have to do it using the 3" screen on the camera first. Whatever, I'll import into iPhoto on my Mac. If only the camera would stay connected to the computer! After 20 aggravating minutes, I gave up and loaded the SD card into the adapter attached to my computer and uploaded that way. You can "upload" an album to twitter and facebook (sorry, no other video/photo sharing apps) from the CIG, but to share them with your friends requires password? That would be because you aren't uploading the pictures, just a link to the album. If you want to create or add to an album on facebook, you'll have to upload the pictures one at a time; can't "select all" and be done with it. After taking hundreds of pictures, that ain't happening. The wireless function on this camera is, in a word, ONEROUS.

Reviews.Title: Mixed bag!
Reviews.Author: Don
Reviews.Content: Good price,  excellent quality.  Documentation is inadequate.  Setting up the wireless features is a huge problem.  Transferring videos wirelessly is limited to two minutes of video.  Be prepared to spend lots of time getting comfortable with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera
Reviews.Author: Steven Wasserman
Reviews.Content: This is the best camera I have ever owned.  It is easy to operate and takes great pictures.  I would definitely recommend the Canon SX510 to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: nenrekk
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for taking pictures of animals and other things at work, it is very easy to use, and the littlest movement of an animal, you still get clear pictures.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera & My Tips for Use
Reviews.Author: The Sparrow
Reviews.Content: Note:I am not only new to this camera but digital photography as well.  This is good for you the reader because I write these tips assuming no knowledge on anyone’s part.Also, I’ve had this camera just a couple of days…my tips will be expanded as I learn new things.Warning:If you are not given to reading directions, i) camera use might be extremely frustrating, and ii) you will be significantly limited in what you can do with this camera.Online Manual:The online manual is quite good, but you have to remember that it is both written and reviewed by those who already know what the camera should do (as opposed to having the manual reviewed by someone who has zero knowledge as I did).  This will be clear from my comments below.Transfer Images to a  PC:The only information the online manual provides for a NON-Wifi tranfer of images to a pc is the System Map on page 125.1. see pages 12-13 of the online manual for inserting and removing a memory card from the camera.2. buy a card reader w/usb and attach to PC.3. insert memory card into card reader (recommend bringing memory card to store from which you will purchase your card reader and have salesperson show you as there can be many slots and it’s not particularly intuitive).4. using windows explorer, move to the DCIM folder.5. go thru the sub-folders to find the jpegs.6. copy and paste the jpeg files to your computer.Memory Card installation & formatting:Directions for installing are on page 12 of the online manual; however, the manual states to format the memory card but the formatting directions  aren’t until page 121.  So here’s what you do:1. turn on the camera2. hit the menu button3. on the FUNC.SET dial, use the right icon as a right arrow and click right to the tool box at the top of the screen.4. on the FUNC.SET dial, use the bottom icon as a down arrow and scroll to FORMAT on the screen.5. press FUNC.SET to choose FORMAT.6. confirm and you’re done.Charging Time:First, there is an error on page 12 of the online manual.  It states, “For details on charging time…” and references page 160.  However, page 160 does NOT provide any information on charging time.  So I timed it myself and it took exactly 1.5 hours.

Reviews.Title: Compact and great camera
Reviews.Author: Yunpeng Li
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my teenage son, he loves it!It is comfortable to hold, has full manual controls and a lot of funny special effects.

Reviews.Title: Great Photos
Reviews.Author: Victor J Cruz
Reviews.Content: This is an upgrade from my other Canon. Super zoom and great pics in low light settings.Make sure you create an account with Canon Image Gateway to link your pics with WIFI to share with Flickr, Facebook, Youtube or any other service. One you link your camera to the Gateway, the rest is easy. Those steps could be tricky. Every else is pure Canon easiness.Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: Not disappointed with this camera.
Reviews.Author: Michelle Perez
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera so I could get decent photos from the stands when my daughter was performing in field show band.  I'm definitely not disappointed.  I did a lot of research and saw that this camera got decent reviews.  I was able to get pretty clear pictures from high in the stands down to the field.  Even at the championships in the Syracuse Carrier Dome, I could zoom right in on her on the field and could see her face clearly.  I'm very pleased with this camera.  I'm sure there are a lot more functions to it that I just haven't learned yet but hope to soon.  The only downfall is that it's pretty large so I can't tuck it away in my purse.  Other than that...great camera!

Reviews.Title: I kinda hate this camera.
Reviews.Author: KD
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera because I needed a megazoom for a specific event. First off, the camera works well and takes better pictures than it probably should. I'm a novice photographer and needed a decent point and shoot to take great pictures. It delivers and my photos are great quality, indoor and outdoor. Reviews.Title: I LOVE THIS CAMERA!
Reviews.Author: Julie Jordan
Reviews.Content: I am so very happy I decided to spend the money on this.  I love it.  I took it out during the "blood" moon eclipse and I got AMAZING pictures.  I can not wait to take this on my adventures!

Reviews.Title: Wow, impressive camera
Reviews.Author: Go for Par
Reviews.Content: I am a casual user of a camera for taking travel and everyday photos. I bought this to replace my Canon Sureshot which broke (when I dropped it). Camera arrived as described and easy to use. I am still trying it figure out how to upload photos via WiFi but is somewhat a time consuming project. Camera takes great photos and offers flexibility from automatic setting to manual settings.  Telephoto /zoom lens has exceeded my expectations. I am happy with my choice in selecting this camera. My previous Canon camera was user friendly and this seems consistent. I will figure out the WiFi upload of photos but in the meantime I can use the cable from my other camera to import photos to my computer. I recommend this camera for its price point, quality of photos, size, and flexibility of features.

Reviews.Title: I'm so happy
Reviews.Author: Somebody stop me
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a cruise. I used this camera and it is awesome. I was directed to this camera by an article in the ORLANDO SENTINEL. The photographers write a small article each week about their photographs. One week one of the photographers wrote about how much he liked this camera and what an awesome deal it is. I wholeheartedly agree. I am so glad I bought it.

Reviews.Title: thanks
Reviews.Author: Faig
Reviews.Content: High quality and smart digital camera. Very practical and functional. Good design. Good deal.Price is low compared with quality.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use. Good value for the cost. Must be very careful of camera shake if not using the flash.
Reviews.Author: Clyde R. Henderson
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera from a local store while visiting in Arizona in January 2014. The trip was supposed to be very short, only a few days, and I was 'traveling light'. The only camera i had with me was my iPhone 5s.As the trip time stretched out to over a month I decided I wanted another camera to take 'better' (i.e. zoomed in) pictures but I didn't want to break the bank for a temporary camera.  Thus the choice of the 510 HS.  The local store agreed to match the Amazon price otherwise I would have ordered it from Amazon as I'm a Prime member.I didn't expect a whole lot from this camera (I own a Canon 5D Mk III and a Canon 7D) but I was surprised in how well it does work if held in a stable manner.  Except for a little bit of softness (described below) one can get very good images using manual mode. I even managed to get a very good image of the moon using 30x magnification--hand held no less--and manual mode.The system is not really sensitive so one has to be careful if not using the flash.  Watch out for the orange symbol indicating camera shake as that indicates the exposure time is below 1/20th of a second.  Anything below about 1/125 is going to give considerable blurring when handheld in a caviler manner.  I suggest using the flash, if possible, whenever the exposure time grows larger than 1/60.Even when taking flash pictures, the images are a bit soft but they usually become 'good enough' if given a little sharpening.  I'm not sure if this softness is native to the 510 HS or if it's my particular unit.  I'm used to the incredibly sharp images I get from my 5D Mk III or 7D so it may just be the softness one can expect from an inexpensive camera with a huge zoom range.  In other words, I'm being too critical of an inexpensive camera with respect to softness of the image.To sum thing up, I'm not sorry I purchased the camera.  It will be used quite a bit for quick snapshots--my wife already prefers the 510 HS to her S95.

Reviews.Title: Small form, big results
Reviews.Author: Jim Elmer
Reviews.Content: I needed a small camera able to zoom long distances that could also take shots in low light.  The higher quality CMOS sensor made a difference in my buying decision, and makes a HUGE difference in picture quality.  The camera it was replacing has a better lens, but really cheap sensor, and even in full daylight couldn't get a clear picture if there was any movement in the frame.  This camera takes clear pictures even when I am all the way through the optical and into the digital zoom ranges.

Reviews.Title: Took camera to Disney World
Reviews.Content: For the money, this is definitely a 5 star camera.  It performed really well.Things I liked about the camera:- Turns on and is ready to use in like two seconds, so it is easy to catch unpredictable shots at any moment.- Really great with low light!  I was able to take some cool shots on indoor rides like "It's a small world" without a flash.  Impressed.- Compact style, it is easy to hold and lightweight.  The rubber grip is great too.- Auto focus is pretty smart, I took alot of clear shots.- Zoom abilities are really powerful. The separate lens really helps get some tight shots.- Inexpensive enough where it isn't the end of the world if it gets lost, stolen or broken during a vacation.- Holds a charge all day, I took about 300+ photos in one day and it worked great.- Uses a thin rechargeable battery - it is more convenient and lightweight than AA batteries.- Feels solid and well made/durable.- Takes quality photos!  It did the job excellently for a point and shoot camera.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Helen
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for a vacation. It performed easily with beautiful pictures. The zoom lens gave us clear pictures with more detail then you can see on the screen. We transferred the pictures to our computer and watched the slide show of amazing pictures. The battery lasted several days without running low so I just recharged it overnight so it was ready to go. I am so glad I chose this camera. Love it.

Reviews.Title: It's ok
Reviews.Author: Jaydedhalo
Reviews.Content: I love that this camera is light weight and not bulky. If you are wanting to take pictures of anything that is moving, or lower light and can't use flash, this is not the camera for you. Even some stills don't come out crisp, or as bright/colorful as the scene you are taking pictures of. Took it to our trip to Hawaii, and I'm disappointed in more pictures then happy with them.

Reviews.Title: BEWARE!!!I
Reviews.Author: shdwdc "Rone"
Reviews.Content: I have been using Canon for the last 15 years. I am now quite familiar with the Canon ELPH series. I was looking for a rather smaller camera to carry around with good telephoto lens. Carrying around my DSLR does take a toll when you are walking about. Especially if you carry a few lenses with you and other equipment. For its ability to take pictures, I believe this camera do deserve at least a 4 star (probably even 5). Low light situation pictures are better. Telephoto pics even with the image stabilizer is still iffy. My problem is the WIFI connection capability. Sounds exciting when I first purchased the camera. Why not. Camera, Video, Wifi...They forgot to mention the system requirements of your computer. IT WILL NOT WORK IF YOU HAVE AN OLDER SYSTEM. Please buyers be aware of this!!! If you are not interested in the Wifi capability, this is quite a good camera. Please check the Canon website for compatibility before you buy...

Reviews.Title: I DID!!!I DID !!! I LOVE IT
Reviews.Author: segovi
Reviews.Content: I LOVE this camera, when I first saw it was "to be released" I started getting exited, I need this camera, the zoom was (is) perfect, the price, eh, not outta sight. Finally the day came, It was available to order, I ordered, waiting, patiently for it to arrive in time for our Disneyland vacation. It arrived. I was sceptical, bigger that I was used to, smaller than I expected, would it live up to my 200? ... Then the I took some test shots, garden pics, they looked beautiful!! So we were off to vacation, I took many, many pictures, day, night, motions, stills, portrait, landscapes, flowers, characters, all looked good but only able to see them on the camera. When I got home, I plugged the camera into my 55" HD tv via the hdmi cable, started the slide show.....The moment of truth! Did I get my monies worth? Risking a $4000.00 vacation photo shoot of hundreds of pictures of my kids, the park, capturing the actual "essence" of our grand vacation on a $329.00 camera?I DID!!!I DID !!!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera, Good Price
Reviews.Author: James Alex Garza Jr.
Reviews.Content: I had been on the fence on buying a good camera to take with me on a study abroad trip overseas and this proved to be a great investment so far.What surprised me the most about this camera was the zoom which even had a pro photographer friend of mine pleasantly surprised by the quality at such distance. The WiFi integration worked smoothly, although I will say that if you have a Mac, there is no direct Camera-Mac link to be made but to me, it really does not matter since it's as easy as downloading from the Canon site or using the SD card.So far, battery life is pretty great. I've gone out downtown for an afternoon shooting and still had three battery indicators full by the end of the day.I am a college student looking to document my trip with great shots with this camera and so far it has not disappointed me! If you are looking for a step up but not ready to buy a $500+ camera, I would definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: CANON POWERSHOT SX510 - POOR QUALITY BUT GOOD FEATURES
Reviews.Author: Patrick Naughten
Reviews.Content: I wanted to like this camera but unfortunately I have to look beyond my favorite CANON powershot line for my next point and shoot camera. I ordered this camera and was so excited to replace my recently deceased 4MP CANON powershot that has amazingly lasted over a decade of service. The first week I convinced myself the SX510 HS was great, it takes beautiful well balanced and colorful photos OUT of automatic and scene selection modes (BUT changing manual settings must be done slowly via on screen menu) and I loved throwing photos wirelessly from the camera to my iphone and could text/email nice photos easily from wherever. Week 2 however, the WiFi would not connect to any device: computer, iphones, imacs, powerbooks, just plain dead. I was enthralled with the feature so I exchanged for a new one. Getting a dud electronic every once in a while is understood, Amazon was great to send a new camera almost next day, and I used the same box/wrapping for my return. That's not worth a bad review. The new replacement camera took less than 10 photos and something started rattling like loose plastic inside the camera...come on. It felt light to begin, convinced that was OK, but this could never replace my trusty old powershot in quality.

Reviews.Title: Works Great
Reviews.Author: Windy Curtains
Reviews.Content: I had difficulty determining this beforehand, so if anyone's unsure, yes you DO have to provide your own memory card, or else you can't use the camera at all.  I bought a Sony 16 GB SDHC/SDHX Class 10 card.  Some memory cards might not be fast enough for video recording.Beyond that, I'm no expert, so listen to others more than me.  That said, I've made some videos with this and was impressed with the quality.  The camera adjusts to light intensity very much like the human eye.  This isn't perfect, but neither is the eye.  I've tried judging colors, to match stains, from the videos and also from looking directly at the same objects with my own eyes.  In both cases, this is quite difficult if brilliant daylight is shining from behind.  However, when I showed my videos to the paint vendor, he was surprised that the recording came out so well.I store the camera in the box it came in.  I don't plan to use it much, so there's no need for a protective case.  If you plan to take this around a lot, buy a case.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera, Good Price
Reviews.Author: James Alex Garza Jr.
Reviews.Content: I had been on the fence on buying a good camera to take with me on a study abroad trip overseas and this proved to be a great investment so far.What surprised me the most about this camera was the zoom which even had a pro photographer friend of mine pleasantly surprised by the quality at such distance. The WiFi integration worked smoothly, although I will say that if you have a Mac, there is no direct Camera-Mac link to be made but to me, it really does not matter since it's as easy as downloading from the Canon site or using the SD card.So far, battery life is pretty great. I've gone out downtown for an afternoon shooting and still had three battery indicators full by the end of the day.I am a college student looking to document my trip with great shots with this camera and so far it has not disappointed me! If you are looking for a step up but not ready to buy a $500+ camera, I would definitely recommend!

Reviews.Author: Windy Curtains
Reviews.Content: I had difficulty determining this beforehand, so if anyone's unsure, yes you DO have to provide your own memory card, or else you can't use the camera at all.  I bought a Sony 16 GB SDHC/SDHX Class 10 card.  Some memory cards might not be fast enough for video recording.Beyond that, I'm no expert, so listen to others more than me.  That said, I've made some videos with this and was impressed with the quality.  The camera adjusts to light intensity very much like the human eye.  This isn't perfect, but neither is the eye.  I've tried judging colors, to match stains, from the videos and also from looking directly at the same objects with my own eyes.  In both cases, this is quite difficult if brilliant daylight is shining from behind.  However, when I showed my videos to the paint vendor, he was surprised that the recording came out so well.I store the camera in the box it came in.  I don't plan to use it much, so there's no need for a protective case.  If you plan to take this around a lot, buy a case.

Reviews.Title: Decent camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Rebecca
Reviews.Content: I wanted something in between a point and shoot and a DSLR.  I'm a Canon girl, and this camera suits me well.  It's not the best money can buy, but considering I didn't have all that much money to give anyway, this was a great buy.

Reviews.Title: As Good as my Canon DSLR
Reviews.Author: D. Swan
Reviews.Content: Just got it today. I was worried about shutter speed but his thing is as responsive as my Canon DSLR. It looks likes a mini-me of it too. Has manual mode, fish-eye and killer, killer zoom!!! Plus records Full HD with wi-fi! Awesome! Get it.

Reviews.Title: Decent camera
Reviews.Author: pml
Reviews.Content: This camera is good, pictures come out fine.The reason I only marked it as 3 stars is because it doesn't seem to have a a major benefit over a regular Canon point-and-shoot.I was looking for a little more sophistication which I don't think this camera  has.Its size and weight are good but then again, the point-and-shoot are more compact and give you the same results.The big zoom is nice.You will enjoy it if you are looking for a decent point-and-shoot with a nice zoom (and looks a little more sophisticated than a point-and-shoot :) ) But if you are looking for a "fake" DSLR then this is probably not what you are looking for.Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: Not so Happy
Reviews.Author: Ganesh
Reviews.Content: I am not a pro in cameras....  I was so happy with my canon sd750.  But this is not so good as I expected.  The pictures are blurry at times.  We have to wait for a long time then it clears up... Outdoor pictures are good.  No so good at low light.

Reviews.Title: Great option for travelers who want excellent pictures without a carrying/worrying about a huge $1,000+ investment
Reviews.Author: RachoftheJungle
Reviews.Content: This camera has amazing zoom and picture quality, especially considering its size/price.I've always been a Canon fan (all of my cameras have been Canon: each one has lasted many years of abuse!) and since I've had such good experiences with their cameras I purchased this one. It did not disappoint.I confess: I am not a pro-level photographer, nor am I really into photography as a serious hobby. However, I have a little knowledge/have taken digital photography courses, so I like that this model has some manual settings/options so that I can get fancy if I'm in the mood. Otherwise I just let the camera do the work for me!I travel a lot and like taking pictures of things/people/events that I want to remember. I specifically chose this model because it performs really well, but won't financially ruin me if it gets stolen/broken in the course of my travels. I LOVE that I can rely on this camera to take excellent images, while also focusing on enjoying my surroundings rather than sweating over losing a camera with a huge price tag. The worst part of losing this bad boy would be losing the pics you'd have on the memory card. And for that, with the Wifi feature, you can upload/backup your pics on the go while taking a break at a cafe for extra peace of mind.Also, while it certainly isn't nearly as compact as my Elph (the credit-card-sized camera I've used for the past 4 years), it isn't unreasonably huge. I personally prefer to be able to stash my camera in a small purse rather than walk around with a huge camera bag or worse yet, with a huge camera dangling around my neck.So, overall, I love it. Canon, you've got me for life! Keep making stuff like this and I'll keep buying from you.

Reviews.Title: The Perfect Camera for the average person
Reviews.Author: montanagirl
Reviews.Content: I am, what I call, the average photographic consumer. I need great pictures from a camera that doesn't require extensive photography knowledge. This camera is perfect! It takes high quality photographs with ease. Has a camera body that is easy to hold (I find the slimline body styles harder to hold still). It is lightweight, I can carry it around my neck or in my jacket pocket and forget it is there. The zoom is amazing. I've been considering the purchase of a camera of my own for 2 years. I am so glad I selected this one. My husband, a man much more versed photographer, is very impressed with this camera and he uses digital SLRs.If you are looking for an incredible value in a digital camera I suggest the Canon Powershot SX510 HS.

Reviews.Title: Greatest wifi camera
Reviews.Author: A Saltz
Reviews.Content: Works very well! Rookie or pro, this camera is completely adjustable and easy to use.You can send your pics staight to your phone or computer which reliefs your memory card.Super worth its price!

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: Blusky
Reviews.Content: I have a canon DSLR and have had several way back to using film and recording settings in a notebook.  Was looking for a small, take along camera but one that had some flexibility in settings.  This one is perfect.  Gives you many options for auto settings as well as manual mode.  I'm fairly sure that except for the ability to change lenses, it is far more capable then my DSLR.  Very happy with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: One of the best camera i ever owned
Reviews.Author: William Bieschke
Reviews.Content: The camera is easy to use. Just set it on auto, point, look, and snap. Perfect picture every time, every shot.

Reviews.Title: Great cam canons are the best
Reviews.Author: Wayne Sobers
Reviews.Content: Picture quality is great with or without flash refresh time could be faster that's the time between taking one picture and another

Reviews.Title: Do not purchase this camera
Reviews.Author: KLP "Hooked on books"
Reviews.Content: It worked fine for a while then it just stopped working. It was still under warranty so I contacted Canon's warranty people who told me to send it to them. I did - at my expense. They responded quickly that it would not be repaired. They said their "warranty" on their "lower end" cameras is not really for repair. What they do is take a similar camera off the shelf and send it to you. They do not repair the camera you sent and send it back. They said there is no guarantee that you will get the same camera model or one with the same features. When I pointed out that this seemed to fly in the face of their warranty they had no reasonable comment other than to say that I could certainly buy another camera.It's really too bad because I liked the camera and its features. Needless to say I will never buy another Canon.

Reviews.Title: This Thing Is Awsome!
Reviews.Author: CLC "fsufan7"
Reviews.Content: I have to tell you I spent a lot of time reviewing cameras before I actually pulled the trigger. I read review after review after review, describing features and benefits, likes and dislikes of almost every similarly priced camera of almost every make and model. My wife and I are about to have our first and second child and were looking for a decently priced camera that would suite our needs, such as low light and random movement often experienced by children. Based off of the reviews by both customers and c-net and the like I decided on this model.There are only a few pictures through it so far, but y wife is extremely satisfied so far. The pictures are crisp and clear, the functions are easy to operate, and the Wi-Fi is really convenient. I have taken pictures of our dogs both in and out of the house, squirrels running around outside, and everything that has come out of it has been wonderful.Overall I am extremely happy that I chose this camera. I really do not think I could have done better, especially for the price.

Reviews.Title: Excellent deal!
Reviews.Author: Dave
Reviews.Content: No viewfinder and it would be nice if a manual were included (easy enough to download but paper one would make reference easier on the go).Other than that, I can't find much of anything to complain about.Takes beautiful pictures, remarkable video, layout of settings/ controls is intuitive and easy to use.LCD is nice, bright but as expected difficult to see in bright sun.Camera is small and very lightweight which I find is a plus.Zoom lens quality may be somewhat lacking for seasoned pros (some chromatic aberations) but I find it extremely useful and certainly high enough standards/ quality for my use ... and the camrea is well made overall.It's a great camera and fully automatic so easy to use. Manual settings are there if you want to override the auto settings but auto really does a nice job. CMOS sensor produces very nice clear photos, especially at lower ISO settings (400 or less).I'd recommend this camera for anyone wanting a lightweight, easy to use camera that produces quality photos. Wonderful for people on the go.

Reviews.Title: Canon Excellence
Reviews.Author: Marthalie Thurston
Reviews.Content: Over the years I have had many cameras. I miss film, and continue to use it on a limited basis. The SX510 has shown me some amazing ways of the digital camera. The HD full video is truly amazing. This camera was a gift less than a year ago and each day I find something new to try.The con is an occasional focus issue.The pro is everything you would want and hope for in a digital camera.The grip is excellent.Navigating the visible commands and internal menu is clear.This Canon has put my digital Olympus to shame........Regardless of your proficiency I assure you that you have room for this wonderful, dependent camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for the Money
Reviews.Author: Timothy McCall
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my wife for Christmas because she was unhappy with our 5 year old point and shoot digital camera. It has a nice compact design which makes it easy to carry in a bag when traveling. It takes nice clear pictures. It has a reasonable fast shutter time to take the next picture. The optic zoom works great and zooms at a comfortable speed so you're not waiting too long or over zoom too quickly. It has a bunch of advanced features we probably won't use but are fun to have. She likes it a lot.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: techy gal
Reviews.Content: I was looking for an inexpensive quality zoom camera to take on a trip to Europe in addition to my iPhone. This more than Canon fit the bill.  It was small enough to easily stash in a bag avoiding the tourist look with the camera strapped around the neck. It has built in wifi so when I got to the hotel at night I could easily back up pictures just incase. Lastly the picture quality, quick focusing, shutter responsiveness (not much recording lag between pictures) and overall ease of use make this Canon an excellent valueThe only reason I gave this 4 out if 5 stars was that the lens size is smaller than 52mm so it needs an adapter (not included). I wasn't aware if this and ended up having to leave for my trip without a uv filter which I always like to add for lens protection. Also I found the picture review button in a place that I kept hitting while trying to shoot pictures, but that was probably just more me being used to other cameras.

Reviews.Title: Does not like a Canon Product
Reviews.Author: Chung T. Nieh "bronzeram"
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed by this camera. The picture was good in general if you shot family pictures, your pet and your garden. The picture is not crisp clear when you shot in wide landscape, zoom-in, etc. The display screen is not clear too. Beside those, it is too cheap that there is no manual book or CD, no any cable included. I am not a professional photo taker but I use Canon product many years from AE-1 to 5D and many PowerShot cameras. This is worst one I have ever had. There are some good things with this camera: light weight, very small in size, still have a main dial that make easy to shange shooting mode. 30X zoom(if the picture is good).

Reviews.Title: Great Small Camera
Reviews.Author: B. Newsom
Reviews.Content: I needed a camera to take with me.  This fills the bill for that.  It does great close-ups, has a wonderful long range, and has 12 megapixels, which is all anyone needs.

Reviews.Title: Wow!
Reviews.Author: St Joe Mo
Reviews.Content: Bought this for a safari because I wanted a better zoom but not a dslr to lug around. Wow! Best pictures from a point-shoot I have ever taken. Very powerful zoom lens and a great focus system. Fast - good color. Really - this was a great purchase. Battery life is good - but you can buy spare batteries for just a couple bucks.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed...
Reviews.Author: M.N. "maddie"
Reviews.Content: I was so anxious to receive this camera, only to be completely disappointed. I have a Canon PowerShot SX260 HS, and I took pictures side by side and compared the two. The Canon PowerShot SX260 HS took much better photos. The SX 510 had too much noise. Even in the lower ISO setting. Maybe i didn't set it up right, i don't know. All i know is that my Canon PowerShot SX260 HS was alot better, and I've never had to do anything to it but just "Point and Shoot". The SX 510 had blurry photos indoors. It just wasn't right. I wish i was one of those people that got the good camera. Maybe it was a lemon. Don't know. I sure don't feel like giving it another shot. =(

Reviews.Title: Good Lightweight Camera at this Price Point
Reviews.Author: Harland Melville "H. Melville"
Reviews.Content: I moved up to this camera from a $100-level Canon.  I like that the controls and instructions are similar. Also I love how lightweight it is -- it does not have AA batteries where the "hump" is -- everything runs off one Lithium battery, saving weight.  My main disappointment is that is it not shockingly sharper than the cheaper Canon.  But it DOES zoom a lot during both stills AND MOVIES, so those are big pluses.  So all in all , quite satisfied, but not blown-away by the photos it takes.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera until it broke
Reviews.Author: Wil Ketchin "WiL"
Reviews.Content: Fantastic little camera with a great lens and awesome zoom. I took it on vacation to Jamaica with my girlfriend and they really captured the experience. The video is impressive and the stabilization is really useful when you're filming while walking or driving. I love this little camera.HoweverI purchased it on March 24th 2014, and today, May 18th 2014 it has stopped functioning properly. Less than 2 months. I am outside of the 30 day exchange period, so I will have to pay shipping to get it replaced or fixed. The button that snaps the photo, as well as the zoom slider have both become difficult to use. When I zoom it sticks, and continues to go either out or completely in until it can't any further. The button also intermittently works when I snap a photo, I have to press relatively hard and that leads to a blurry photo. I probably got the lemon of the batch, but in order to review it properly based on my experience I will warrant it only 3 stars.EDIT: I ended up talking to customer service at Amazon, and no questions asked they sent me a return label. Since it will be so easy to exchange, I will bump it up to 4 stars!

Reviews.Title: I love this camera!
Reviews.Author: Brigid
Reviews.Content: This camera is a perfect blend of a digital camera and a professional.Pros- Many different effects to help you take the perfect picture. Once you learn how to use each of them, it's very easy to choose the right effect to help you take a good photo that won't require much editing. I personally love the Vibrant feature, Portrait (blurs the background), and Hi-Speed Burst.- The zoom is incredible, at 30x. I have taken fantastic photos that would have been pixelated from the zoom with other cameras.- 12.1 MP creates flawless photos, it gives the illusion that I have a professional camera and actually know what I'm doing! Haha.- The camera strap is great. I often take pictures at the zoo, and instead of fishing my camera out of my bag, I can just put the strap over my shoulder or go full-tourist by putting it around my neck.- The camera is a nice size that allows you to comfortably grip the camera.- A rechargeable battery is great, I prefer it to carrying around a pack of AAs like I did in the good ol' days. The battery has a long life, and doesn't take long to charge. If I were going on a trip where I didn't have access to electricity, I'd pack an extra battery.Cons- I wish there was a viewfinder! Sometimes it's hard to see the screen when you're in the sun--I had trouble in Hawaii.- WiFi isn't all that great. I prefer taking the SD card and putting pictures right onto my computer, it's a lot faster than waiting for them to upload via WiFi, then downloading them from the site, then editing, etc. If you don't edit your photos, then you would like this feature, I personally don't.- Be careful, it's very easy to delete all of your pictures! I bought this camera right before I went on vacation to Hawaii. After I had taken over 300 photos, I was trying to look at a set of pictures I took with the Hi-Speed Burst function, and accidentally deleted ALL of my photos. I freaked out for a minute, then googled to see what I could do, and it turns out that if you don't take any pictures, you can find software online that will recover every photo you have ever taken on that SD card. It took an entire evening to recover all of my photos, and I'm always very careful when reviewing pictures on the camera so that I don't have to experience that headache again.- Manual focus would've been nice. As this camera is not a DSLR, I can't really blame Canon for not allowing some manual focus... But at times when I'm trying to get the camera to focus where I want it, I have to lightly press the capture button several times until I get what I want. Not unbearable, but in the future it'd be nice.All in all, this is a great camera. I've been using Canon for years, and this is by far the best camera I've ever owned from them. If you want a camera that feels like the lovechild of a DSLR and a Digital Camera, then this is the camera for you.

Reviews.Title: Interesting little Canon camera
Reviews.Author: Stormy1
Reviews.Content: I just received my Canon SX-510 HS digital camera to replace an older Olympus digital camera since I needed a replacement pronto. First thing I noticed when I opened up the box & took out the camera and my first thought was....."holy cow...it's so small!" It looks like my Canon SX-50 HS camera, but smaller with a few features missing.I took a small variety of photos yesterday with this camera and overall, not bad.Photo quality outdoors seems good and also in low light situations, this camera seems to take decent photos without flash. Indoor photo quality seems good with flash. Video quality is fine also and in HD.Overall, this small camera seems easy to use and very similar in ease of use compared to my bigger Canon SX-50 HS camera.Pros include:  easy to use, good menu system, 30X optical zoom, large rear LCD viewfinder, nice quality-looking camera, comfy hand grip....tho a bit smallish, great high speed photo shoot option and finally acceptable photo quality inside and outside.Cons include: a fixed rear LCD viewfinder [not really a big deal], zoom operates a little slow and rather smallish camera. I am not really a big person, but this camera seems tiny.....like a compact point & shoot with a huge zoom on it.To me, this camera seems built for a smaller adult, teen or younger since it's really smaller than I thought. If Canon made the grip just a bit larger, that would have solved the problem....at least they added a rubberized outer coating on the grip and that's a very nice touch.It's a nice little camera that takes decent photos. I intend to keep this camera and overall, I gave this camera 4 of 5 stars mostly due to the fact this camera is a bit smaller than I expected and a bit sluggish with the zoom operation. Otherwise, this is a very nice digital camera.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera!
Reviews.Author: murban12
Reviews.Content: I love this camera! I love that with just a click of a button I can transfer my photos from my camera to my iPhone! Awesome feature! The photos are very clear & even with my daughter always on the move it takes clear photos! Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: Cannon power shot
Reviews.Author: John P
Reviews.Content: Great camera. almost bought the current model for twice the price. The new model has a few more bells and whistles, however this one is great and does everything that I wanted it to do.

Reviews.Title: Terrific camera
Reviews.Author: Linny02
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my husband, who does a lot of nature and wildlife photography but can't afford a big lens and expensive camera body. He is currently doing a photographic "big year" of birding and he absolutely loves this camera.

Reviews.Title: Good camera taking great pictures. But it's bulky
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This Canon takes better pictures than my older SX120 iS. The 30x zoom is great for travel shots. The WiFi transfer of photos to my tablet or laptop is very easy. It makes transferring photos for sharing and backup very easy so I can do it everyday when travelling. I don't like that videos can't be transferred via WiFi. Transferring videos requires cabling the camera to a laptop or doing a manual transfer from the SD card using an adapter on a tablet or laptop.The only con is I don't like the use of a rechargeable battery on this one. The SX120 uses Lithium AAs which are much easier to deal with when travelling. I've already lost one charger and battery for the SX510 by leaving it in a hotel room outlet. You have to have a spare charged battery available at all times since one charge will only take about 150 photos of full size.So the battery situation isn't ideal. But otherwise it's a good camera which produces some great shots.

Reviews.Title: Terrific camera
Reviews.Author: Linny02
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my husband, who does a lot of nature and wildlife photography but can't afford a big lens and expensive camera body. He is currently doing a photographic "big year" of birding and he absolutely loves this camera.

Reviews.Title: Good camera taking great pictures. But it's bulky
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This Canon takes better pictures than my older SX120 iS. The 30x zoom is great for travel shots. The WiFi transfer of photos to my tablet or laptop is very easy. It makes transferring photos for sharing and backup very easy so I can do it everyday when travelling. I don't like that videos can't be transferred via WiFi. Transferring videos requires cabling the camera to a laptop or doing a manual transfer from the SD card using an adapter on a tablet or laptop.The only con is I don't like the use of a rechargeable battery on this one. The SX120 uses Lithium AAs which are much easier to deal with when travelling. I've already lost one charger and battery for the SX510 by leaving it in a hotel room outlet. You have to have a spare charged battery available at all times since one charge will only take about 150 photos of full size.So the battery situation isn't ideal. But otherwise it's a good camera which produces some great shots.

Reviews.Title: I love this camera!
Reviews.Author: Gabriela
Reviews.Content: This camera is absolutely amazing. I love it. It is simple to use and takes great quality photographs. The extra effects are fun to use and simple to figure out. I can't wait to try this camera on our vacation.

Reviews.Title: good camera
Reviews.Author: Stanley Hall "G.C. Book"
Reviews.Content: Works Great.  But forget programming the wireless functions by the book, the twine shell never meet!  Just call tech support, a lot was left out of the book. it was like someone who never used the camera wrote it.

Reviews.Title: The best camera I ever bought
Reviews.Author: Harry
Reviews.Content: It's really the best in its price range & Bluetooth photo transfer is easy to use with IPhone app ...

Reviews.Title: Very Nice
Reviews.Author: J. Biener
Reviews.Content: Love it. Not SLR but goes places where I just won't drag a larger camera, which is almost everywhere! User friendly.

Reviews.Title: Loved it until screen went black
Reviews.Author: shavon
Reviews.Content: I love my camera and I'm really sad the screen randomly went out. Everything else works and I take good care of the camera so I'm not sure what happened, but Amazon is sending a replacement in a few days which I am very happy about. No hassle, no fee or anything. Hopefully this one works fine

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: gailt
Reviews.Content: Compact, but big on amenities!  I'm used to having a slip in your pocket type camera.  This reminds me a lot of our old Nikon or Minolta SLRs, but or course, it's digital!

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Bill & Dawn Crawford
Reviews.Content: Love this camera! perfect size and takes great pictures near and far.  It's great for taking on trips where you don't want to bring a big camera and still get quality pictures. Great Price too!

Reviews.Title: Beautiful
Reviews.Author: Eduardo
Reviews.Content: This camera is awesome, the pictures are great, it is not too big not too small, it's just perfect and the price was great! Very happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Great camera overall
Reviews.Author: Karin Rittenhouse
Reviews.Content: Great camera.  Love the wireless feature to download pic to my iPad.  The thing I don't much like is that it's extremely difficult to get a sharp picture when using the high zoom.  Even with a tripod I have difficulties focusing it.  Other than that, it's easy enough to use.

Reviews.Title: AWESOME!!!
Reviews.Author: Salvatore Fusco
Reviews.Content: This camera is Awesome!!! Take excellent pictures and videos. One draw back though...when recording in 1080HD it only records for a minute and 15 seconds. You get much more when you switch it to 720HD or standard recording.

Reviews.Title: Smart enough to make even my pictures look good!
Reviews.Author: K. Ingram "spiffykyle"
Reviews.Content: This is our first upgrade from a standard, inexpensive, compact point and shoot. Maybe it is just me but I am blown away! I think the average person will find this camera to be fantastic. Photography nuts will undoubtedly find issues with controls and sensors and things, but for the rest of us that just want to take a good picture, it fits the bill.Size: This thing is a little smaller than I was expecting, and that is great. It is easy to take pictures with one hand if need be, but is also comfortable to hold in two hands.Pictures: To my eye, the pictures out of this thing are great, and much improved over our older cameras and current cell phones. For now I have just been using the Auto settings and letting the camera decide what internal things to change, and it is great. I am a notoriously bad photographer (at least according to my wife) and even she things I take good pictures with this camera.Usability: I haven't played with the picture taking settings yet (ISO, aperture, etc). But I have played with some of the pre-set configurations and they work as advertised. It is easy to adjust so I think I will sit down one day and really get a feel for what I can change. Taking movies on this thing is ridiculously easy. Push the little red button by your right thumb and you are in movie mode. Sound comes in pretty well and the movies look great on our TV. The optical zoom is excellent and the "finder" feature when zoomed way in is indispensable.WiFi: So setting up the wifi was amazingly easy for me. The instruction book jumps around a bit but if you follow the instructions, it takes less than 5 minutes. I have successfully connected the camera to my home Wifi and computer, as well as my tablet and phone. I love that I can connect it to my phone/tablet even without an available wifi (the camera itself becomes the hotspot). This is perfect for downloading vacation pictures in the evening.Overall, I am very pleased with this purchase. For the price, I feel that I am getting a great camera with a ton of features. For those that want more than a traditional point and shoot rectangle camera, but don't want to drop a grand on a DSLR setup, this camera is perfect. Even my photog friends are impressed with the capabilities of this little guy.

Reviews.Title: Great Photos, extremely flakey wifi...
Reviews.Author: Chuck
Reviews.Content: So the Camera itself has been great so far. I have take some great photos with it and it has taken some great movies too. The zoom is pretty good although indoors it does have a bit of a tough time gaining focus when zoomed too far in. I like the added adjustments it has.The two complaints have have are one, the microphone is a bit weak, in that it doeasn't pick up voices all that well and when taking video outside, even with the wind filter on, it really picks up wind noise. Plus, it also picks up the zoom motor when zooming during a movie.The other issue is the wifi. I have two main issues...1) It doesn't recognize wireless access points properly. I have 2 routers, one at each end of the house, because one router will not cover the full house. I have one set up as the main router and the other as an access point. With just about all other devices, I only see one wireless network in my house for the "G" network(as I should) and devices will just use the access point, to that network, with the strongest signal when connecting. HOWEVER, with the camera, I see two completely separate networks, both named with the identical name. So when I goto connect, it will always try to use the access point it used prior. If it is out of range, it fails and I have to redo the setup, choosing the other network of the same name and connect. Since this thing doesn't have great wireless range, I also sometimes get the "Invalid Password" error, if I am too far from the access point it is trying to use. This REALLY gets annoying after a while having to change the "network" I am using depending on where I am in the house.2. As mentioned in 1, when it has a weak signal, it is quick to suddenly not recognize my wifi password, giving my a "Password is Invalid" message. Moving right next to the router will sometimes correct it but it will still fail sometimes. Even choosing the "other" network(aka access point) it still won't recognize the password. Once it gets the password error, it seems like it gets stuck in the mode somethimes and the only way to get it to connect it do a WPS connection with the routers. Once I do that, it will be fine until the next time I try to connect and I am too far from the access point it is set to use and I get the error again.The wifi issues are enough to really sour me on a good camera. One of the reasons I liked this camera was because of the wifi. I love not having to mess around with cables and such getting my photos/movies to the PC.I gave it 4 stars but it probably should be 3.5, as the pictures are great so far(which is what a camera is for) but if it supposed to have wifi as a main feature then it should be implemented right and it's not.Pros...Great photos so farGreat movies so farMany setting to choose from, even includes a manual focus modeCons...Poor microphone for moviesZoom motor noise during movies.WIFI issues!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Nice camera.
Reviews.Author: Carl A Smith
Reviews.Content: Nice camera takes excellent pictures. Now the bad part. Instructions are only for wi fi. No instructions for use of camera unless you go on line. At least basic instructions should have been included.

Reviews.Title: Soft images
Reviews.Author: KRB
Reviews.Content: I have an iPhone 5s. I love the photos that I take with my phone. However I also wanted the ability to take cameras with an optical zoom. After reading all of the reviews I selected this camera expecting to get at least as high of quality as my 5S. No such luck. I took side by side photos without the zoom. The Canon photos were of amazingly poor quality compared to the 5S. I was actually shocked by the difference.If you want a point and shoot and aren't picky about getting a sharp photo this camera is easy to use. I like the grip on the side. Just don't expect to print this larger than 4x6.

Reviews.Title: It's an ok buy
Reviews.Author: LaShondra Bell
Reviews.Content: I like the quality of the camera, but I do not like how hard it is to actually post your pictures to the media sites. I still have not figured that one out yet. It takes really good pictures though. I also love the zoom feature. I was able to zoom directly in on my son on the football field, over 60 yards away. Great feature.... I thik they need to work on a better way to post your pictures to sites likeFacebook.

Reviews.Title: For the price, it is hard to beat this camera
Reviews.Author: Taylor Armstrong
Reviews.Content: Tech in cameras is ever improving and Canon is ahead of the game for it's bang for the buck.Without making this a terribly long review, the basic features of this camera are flawless.The zoom, though it is a very large lens (look at the side view) the zoom is clear and fast.It has many features for finding the object you are looking for which can be found on the online user manual)The HD video...with image stabilziation cannot be beat for this price. You will never shoot a better looking video while walking and holding this camera in your hand.The flash (you have to lift it up manually) is great fot it's size though I'd suggest getting an SLR if you really need a nice flash and/or shoe.Very glad I purchased this camera and would do so again.WILL upate with any issues..

Reviews.Title: Digital Camera

Reviews.Content: This camera was recommended to me by a trusted friend and its even more than what he showed me. I couldn't ask for more in a small digital camera. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: Ok camera

Reviews.Content: I wanted a simple point and shoot camera with digital features. My husband and  I are having a difficult time taking photos that are not blurry. I don't know if there is a trick to taking photos with this camera that I am not aware of, but clear shots are eluding us.

Reviews.Title: For the price, it is hard to beat this camera

Reviews.Title: Very happy with the camera.
Reviews.Author: GraniteM
Reviews.Content: Excellent little camera. Very light, very compact. Fantastic zoom lens and very nice manual features.Only a couple of small things are a little bit irksome. Due to it being such a small camera, the grip on the right hand side is a bit cramped. It can be difficult to figure out a way to comfortably grasp the camera, especially if you have larger hands. Secondly, the additional camera modes seem a bit arbitrary and not necessarily the best choices; it has an artificial "fish eye lens" effect, but no automatic panorama, which seems like an odd choice to include the former but not the latter. Lastly, the WiFi functionality is very useful, but could use a bit of tweaking. The process of connecting to a local network or device isn't exactly intuitive, and the process of selecting multiple photos to upload and add comments to them is a bit cumbersome. The functionality is definitely very nice, but it feels like it might need some improvement.Overall, however, I'm very happy with the camera. It could use a few small improvements, but for the price you're getting an excellent camera.

Reviews.Title: Excellent choice
Reviews.Author: SAH
Reviews.Content: This was a gift and was greatly appreciated!  So far, the camera has taken great photos and videos.  Highly recommend

Reviews.Title: My Canon PowerShot I love it

I recommend this camera it has Wi Fi which makes it easy to send photos on to Facebook or your google account

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Bruce Tandy
Reviews.Content: The camera works great, the 30 X zoom, all optical, makes it fun to use and very user-friendly. A good buy.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot SX510 camera
Reviews.Author: Ludy Herrera
Reviews.Content: Was lucky to have this camera with amazing zoom capacity on our recent South American cruise however, would have liked a faster shutter speed!  Found myself missing out on some pictures while traveling on bus!  Pictures are pretty good however!

Reviews.Title: Loved it until screen went black
Reviews.Author: shavon
Reviews.Content: I love my camera and I'm really sad the screen randomly went out. Everything else works and I take good care of the camera so I'm not sure what happened, but Amazon is sending a replacement in a few days which I am very happy about. No hassle, no fee or anything. Reviews.Content: Love the camera. Takes great photos. I still have a lot to learn about it, and use the settings more. It can take movies while you take photos (Movie Digest setting) -- which is awesome on holidays, you can take both and not sacrifice one or the other! I love that! Reviews.Title: canon
Reviews.Author: Rich
Reviews.Content: camera provides excellent pics & videos but instructions for use (downloading  pics, videos etc)too complicated. This is a problem for most technical manuals but particularly for this camera

Reviews.Content: The 12MP provides incredible detail and the 30x Zoom is amazing. I'm just now starting to dive into the on-board effects... Can't wait.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot 510HS is a great camera for all.
Reviews.Author: J. Kurz "J. Q. Public"
Reviews.Content: I got this model, over the 500, because of the 1080 video.  The 500 has 16MP but only 720 video. The 510's 1080 video is awesome.  I was not disappointed.  I can shoot beautiful video on the fly and you can still zoom in and out while filming.This camera is diminutive.  I mean VERY SMALL!  But I have medium/large hands and it fit my grip quite well.  The small size also means it is light weight. It won't quite fit in a pants pocket, but if you have cargo pants you may be able to fit it into one of the cargo pockets.  But it comes with a neck/shoulder strap so you can wear it that way as well,A few other reviewers have commented on the camera saying they could not take a clear picture.  I would say it is user error because I have not experienced any blurred pictures.  The auto focus takes some getting used to for people who have never used auto focus.  The shutter is not instantaneous.  You have to hold the camera still until after the shot is complete.  You can't simply press the shutter and take the pictures,  You have to wait until the shot is done before moving the camera.The camera has LOADS of options for shooting, similar to  a DSLR.  But the Auto feature yields good results as well.I am very pleased with this camera.  I would buy it again.  The video is very good and the still images  are also as good.  I would recommend this camera for anyone who wants more control over their video and camera abilities. You'll enjoy this camera if you are looking for a smaller camera.  I bought it because I didn't want to take my expensive DSLR on a family trip.  This camera is a cross between point-and-shoot and a DSLR.

Reviews.Title: love this camera
Reviews.Author: Judy R.
Reviews.Content: I have not had this camera very long yet and I am still "playing" with it.  I am very satisfied with it.  I use this camera for photos of my grandkids and hope to use it for my hiking and biking trips.  I wish it came with a hard copy of the owners manual because I have problems on the Canon website.
